Class ForkMergeParser

java.lang.Object
  xtc.lang.cpp.ForkMergeParser

public class ForkMergeParser
extends Object

This class expands macros and processes header files

Version:
$Revision: 1.179 $

Nested Class Summary
static class ForkMergeParser.Lookahead
          A lookahead token.
 class ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax
          A syntax object and it's sequence number, buffered in a linked-list so that multiple subparsers can read tokens from the same stream.
static class ForkMergeParser.StateStack
          A frame of the parsing state stack.

follow

public Map<Integer,ForkMergeParser.Lookahead> follow(ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax a,
                                                     xtc.lang.cpp.ContextManager.Context presenceCondition)
                                              throws IOException
Find the FOLLOW set of a given token. When the given token is an ordinary token, the set is just the token alone. But when the token is a conditional, this method returns the set of ordinary tokens reachable from this conditional in all configurations.

Parameters:
a - The token to find the follow set of.
presenceCondition - The presence condition of a. This presence condition will be freed, so pass a reference.
Returns:
The follow set of the given token.
Throws:
IOException

hasCachedSet

public boolean hasCachedSet(ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax t)
Test whether the conditional token already has a follow-set computed.

Parameters:
t - The conditional.
Returns:
true if the follow-set is cached.

getCachedSet

public Collection<ForkMergeParser.Lookahead> getCachedSet(ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax t)
Get the cached follow-set for a conditional token.

Parameters:
t - The conditional.
Returns:
The follow-set.

setCachedSet

public void setCachedSet(ForkMergeParser.OrderedSyntax t,
                         Collection<ForkMergeParser.Lookahead> follow)
Cache the conditional token's follow-set.

Parameters:
t - The conditional.

isParseable

public static boolean isParseable(Syntax syntax)
Determine whether a token is parseable. The only parseable tokens are Language tokens and EOF.

Parameters:
syntax - The syntax to test for parseability.
Returns:
true if the syntax is a Language or EOF token.
